intro: Diaphananthe ichneumonea, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has smooth, green stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers emit a strong, sweet fragrance, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in warm, humid climates.
